answers.answer: I have it. Last pregnancy I got it at 28wks, this time from 15wks. Its rare to occur before 20wks but it does happen. Try not to read too much on the net because there are a lot of horror stories that will freak you out. Just relax, drink lots of water and keep that blood pressure down! I got to 35wks with my first and am still aiming for 36wks with this one. Don't be surprised if your dr puts you on calcium, aspirin and a low-fat diet, it will all help keep baby in there and keep you healthy. Take care!

Thanks. Yes, the internet is filled with horror stories. I'm glad everything worked out for you and your little one. Your advice and info on it is extremely helpful. Thank you again. Praying for the best for both of us and our little ones. I have been focusing on trying to keep my blood pressure down the most. :-)

question: 12 weeks and Dr said I had 2 out of 3 signs. Which is high blood pressure and protein in urine. They didn't officially diagnose me with it, but set me up an appt 3 weeks later?! Has anyone else been told this in their 1st trimester?  I know the horrors of this and freaks me out.
title: Preeclampsia?
